author: Michael McNulty
title: Calling All Deadheads!
description: Catalyst sits at the forefront of innovation in distributed decision-making. We don't have any historical models to guide us. Or do we?

author: timothy eichler
title: Behavioural based governance
description: Our governance systems are super complex and are often underdesigned, most solutions solve problems that were not fully understood

author: Ryan Morrison
title: Catalystwinners.com
description: It is currently not easy to find which projects have won on each Fund. That could eventually undermine the transparency of Catalyst.

author: Nathan Windsor
title: Open Source Governance UI
description: Users are overwhelmed by distributed decision making, and developers do not have the funding to complete the network upgrades.

author: Tevo
title: Governance tools to boost collabs
description: Information about The Project Catalyst is not well structured and easily accessible

author: F
title: Idea: decentralized hierarchies
description: It's hard to determine the best way to distribute power, hierarchies are necessary but it's almost impossible to make them right.

author: jeffg
title: Working Groups
description: We need to assemble talent in groups to then assign workflow and create synergies and efficiencies.

author: Greg Bell
title: Guides to project Catalyst success
description: Catalyst is a confusing place when you are new to it. New users don't have a really concise guide to doing well on Project Catalyst

author: Callie Bolton
title: Meta-Memory (Fmrly Fed. Debate)
description: Debates and discussion are marred by talking past one another and pushing misinformation or logical fallacies, often obscured or hidden.

author: Adagov.Org
title: Adagov.org (Co-creation)
description: Multiple proposals create a fragmented governance ecosystem with very few coordinating principles. Proposals are unlikely to work together.

author: Kenric Nelson
title: Diversify Voting Influence
description: Voting, like stakepools, requires balanced incentives to encourage a diversity of participants to ensure broad community support.

author: Niels Kijf
title: Voltaire Assistant (Swarm Sessions)
description: ‌Project Catalyst needs a way to direct decentralized energies supplied by the community into achieving desirable outcomes.

author: Philip Khoo
title: Infographics - Series 1
description: Information about Project Catalyst is difficult to digest for many.

author: leadtimenull
title: The Great Filter ❌✅
description: Project Catalyst's form encourages rational ignorance; The more engagement we get, the harder it is to maintain meaningful participation.

author: jeffg
title: New Compensation Plan
description:
Currently only idea creators (Proposers) and some Referrers are being rewarded.
We need to expand compensation to more participants.

author: Chris Ossman
title: Cardanotes
description: Cardano needs a platform where great concepts meet great skills. The iPod required the vision of Steve Jobs and the engineers who built it.

author: mani mejia
title: Voluntary.Gold: a community network
description: Worldwide cardano community lacks a decentralized platform for collaboration, leadership development, social interaction, & incentivisation.

author: Megan Hess
title: +WADA Outreach=Smart Catalyst Users
description: WADA's outreach is currently limited by their web app capacity. They need their own solid integrated management system to optimize outreach.

author: Rfranks08
title: AI Proposal Evaluation and Guidance
description: We're relying on humans to critique an ever growing set of proposals; how can AI provide higher quality feedback and improve results
